chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Zehnder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Case #22CF4-Count #1 and on Case #22CF5-Count #1 each:  the Court sentences Mr. Zehnder to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  1  year.  These sentences are concurrent to one another, but collectively consecutive to any sentence in being.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #22CF4, #2CF5 called at 9:36am
Defendant Robert A Zehnder in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Informations is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered

Constitutional rights are given; elements are recited; plea of " No Contest " entered in case #22CF4-Count #1 and in case #22CF5-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Zehnder guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #2 of case #22CF4.

On Case #22CF4-Count #1 and on Case #22CF5-Count #1 each:  the Court sentences Mr. Zehnder to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  1  year.  These sentences are concurrent to one another, but collectively consecutive to any sentence in being.   
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling 
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to submit to any drug testing as requested by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, and surcharges including the DNA surcharge


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
recess 10:07am
Criminal Case Settlement
Arraignment on June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Cases 22CF4 and 22CF5 called at 8:55AM
Defendant Robert A Zehnder in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the Zoom connection is sight and sound sufficent.
ADA Jeffrey Shock verifies Victim Rights Compliance.

Att De La Rosa advises that the Defendant will be waiving his right to a Prelimianry Hearings. The Court proceeds with a Waivers of Preliminary Hearings:

Mr. Zehnder waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Court defers Arraignment to the next scheduled hearing.

recess 9:01AM

NEXT: Arraignment (and possible Plea and Sentencing) on 06/23 at 9:30AM via video confenrece

Waiver of Prelim on May 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.

[MK] cases #22CF4 and #22CF5 called at 9:00am 
Defendant Robert A Zehnder does not appear. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
These cases are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings today, and the State's officer-witnesses have been present.  However it has been learned that Mr. Zehnder was transfered to Dodge Correctional Institution recently.
After discussion with counsel, the Court schedules the cases for a prelim-waiver hearing.
recess 9:04am.

NEXT:  Prelim-Waiver Hearing in both cases on May 10th at 8:45am -this hearing is to be held with appearances by Zoom Conference

[ma] Cases 22CF4 & 22CF5 called at 1:23pm
Defendant Robert A Zehnder appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearance occurs in both cases:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a seperate $1000  Signature Bond  in each case with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

recess 1:27 pm.
